reporting-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office

title.narrative: Supporting regulatory reform of the Shenzhen private equity market

description.narrative: The project is designed to promote regulatory reform of the Shenzhen private equity market. This supports China's drive to reform its economy under its 13th Five Year Plan, one focus of which is to address the fact that regulation has not kept pace with market development. If enacted, such reform can enable direction of finance in China towards the most innovative and efficient sectors of the economy, to support economic rebalancing, financial inclusion and poverty reduction, particularly for the growth of SMEs. The support is aimed at helping the Shenzhen government introduce a pilot plan with an aim to further broaden and deepen its private equity market through expanding quotas and relaxing regulatory restriction on foreign market participants.

participating-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office
